definition: to form a scar/to form a scab
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
scar/scab

sentences.english: The cut on his finger will eventually scar over.
sentences.chinese: 他指頭上的傷口最後會結疤痊癒。

sentences.english: Scab is unavoidable in the process of high-pressure digestion.
sentences.chinese: 高壓溶出過程，結疤的產生是不可避免的。

sentences.english: A sizing or glaze made of egg white.
sentences.chinese: 蛋白的生長將會使新皮無結疤之慮。

sentences.english: This makes them worse and may cause scarring.
sentences.chinese: 這使他們更壞，並且也許導致結疤。

sentences.english: After a heart attack, for example, the dead portion of the heart muscle scars over.
sentences.chinese: 例如，心臟病發作後，死亡的那部分心肌會結疤。

sentences.english: Sunburn never causes a third-degree burn or scarring.
sentences.chinese: 曬斑不會導致三度燒傷或結疤。

pinkeye/envy/jealousy
nape
to slap/to smack/to punch
livor mortis
paronychia (medicine)
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
ankle
tense situation/standoff
armpit/also pr. [ge1 zhi5 wo1]/also written 夾肢窩|夹肢窝[ga1 zhi5 wo1]
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
